definitions.definition: Nevertheless ; yet , still ; in spite of that.
examples: He told me not to do it. However , I did it anyway. / I did it anyway, however . / I, however , did it anyway.
She wanted to go; however , she decided against it.
I didn't argue with him; I still think, however , that he is wrong.
The conference itself went very well. The party afterwards, however , was a disaster.
However clear you think you've been, and however many questions you may've answered, there'll always remain some doubts.
Any rule of thumb, however true (it is), is useless unless you understand its underlying logic.
However much I study, I never get good grades.

definitions.definition: In any way that one likes or chooses; in a haphazard or spontaneous way.
examples: I don't care; just do it however .
Nothing was really planned; things just happened however .

definitions.definition: How ever : an emphatic form of how , used to ask in what manner .
examples: I thought it was impossible. However were you able to do it?

definitions.definition: In any case , at any rate , at all events .

main_definition: ( conjunctive ) Nevertheless ; yet , still ; in spite of that.
secondary_definitions: ( degree ) To whatever degree or extent .
( informal , manner ) In any way that one likes or chooses; in a haphazard or spontaneous way.
( interrogative ) How ever : an emphatic form of how , used to ask in what manner .
( obsolete ) In any case , at any rate , at all events .
